{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2972813,"name":"Blake Bourque","username":"techplex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/techplex/{size}/195570_2.png","created_at":"2021-10-21T13:24:42.799Z","cooked":"

Has anyone seen CTRE CAN devices blink Red and Yellow at the same time? Below is a video of a number of Falcon 500’s and a PDP doing the odd blink.

Google Photos

New video by Blake Bourque (Techplex Engineer)

We narrowed down which devices were causing the problem and had to factory reset and reflash them a couple of times to make the problem go away.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2021-10-21T13:24:42.799Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":314,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":1592.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":396727,"topic_slug":"ctre-yellow-red-blink","display_username":"Blake Bourque","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://photos.app.goo.gl/AK3PNt2kpDtLFvgg9","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":34}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12397,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead Mentor 4909"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-yellow-red-blink/396727/1","custom_user_title":"Lead Mentor 4909","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":2972819,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2021-10-21T14:14:32.315Z","cooked":"

Which device update fixed this?

According to the docs, things were in a pretty bad state (links below)… Partitioning the CAN bus might be a reasonable thing to do in this case – if you did this, how many devices stayed in the strange state when they were isolated? Do you happen to have any guesses as to how things got this way? I’ve seen most of the blink codes at one time or another, but can’t recall seeing most devices on a robot in this state.

Status Light Quick Reference

Many of the components of the FRC ® Control System have indicator lights that can be used to quickly diagnose problems with your robot. This guide shows each of the hardware components and describe...

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2021-10-21T14:14:32.315Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":49.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":396727,"topic_slug":"ctre-yellow-red-blink","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/latest/docs/hardware/hardware-basics/status-lights-ref.html#pdp-special-states","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Status Light Quick Reference — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":29},{"url":"https://www.ctr-electronics.com/downloads/pdf/Falcon%20500%20User%20Guide.pdf","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ctre-yellow-red-blink/396727/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2972823,"name":"Blake Bourque","username":"techplex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/techplex/{size}/195570_2.png","created_at":"2021-10-21T14:28:06.118Z","cooked":"

We’ll need to do more testing to confirm, however my hypothesis is that it has to do with using the flash many feature when there are multiple devices with the same CAN ID.

We identified two Falcons that would upset the bus by isolating devices on the CAN Bus. We connected the “unhappy devices” directly to the RIO and conducted a factory reset then reflashed. If we only do a factory reset or only a flash the problem persists, it seems reset then flash is required to “fix” the device.

Flashing red like that indicates CAN bus errors.
I’ve most often seen this happen when multiple devices have the same ID, but this could also be a wiring issue.
Check Tuner to see if any devices indicate ID conflicts. If that doesn’t help, start narrowing down what exactly is causing this by isolating devices.
This portion of the Phoenix Docs can help guide you through:

docs.ctre-phoenix.com

Bring Up: CAN Bus

Now that all of the software is installed and verified, the next major step is to setup hardware and firmware. Understand the goal: At this point we want to have reliable communication with CAN dev...

techplex:

when there are multiple devices with the same CAN ID

Multiple devices with the same ID will cause CAN errors. The “Update all devices with matching type” doesn’t require same-ID, only same hardware type.

Seems like a reasonable hypothesis, but you’re in good hands with CTRE, so I’m deferring to them.
